attributes.action: Void the first year of A levels and only test students on second year content
attributes.additional_details: The teaching we are missing out on will effect our future ambitions as students who would want to go to university may not get in due to being able to reach their potential due to not understanding some of the content which could have been covered in a lesson in their college/sixth form This would then effect the UK as it could prevent students who wanted to enter jobs in many important sectors of the economy such as medicine, engineering, law etc.
attributes.background: Currently year 12 students across the country are being asked to work from home which makes it very difficult for many students as they are not receiving the same level of teaching they would if they were in either college or sixth form. This would then affect our grades next year.

rejection.details:
Decisions about assessments and exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament. You can read the decision made by exam boards on what will happen to exams this year here:  https://www.gov.uk/government/news/further-details-on-exams-and-grades-announced   

If you want the Government to review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773 

If you would like the option to repeat a school year, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309265

Exam cancellations and the current coronavirus pandemic can cause worry and stress. You can find information on how to deal with stress here:  

Young Minds: https://youngminds.org.uk/?gclid=Cj0KCQjwpfHzBRCiARIsAHHzyZq25dJRPEYEgu_Jsyh9e-Ehmx_IlSA1wM_dLnm-DFYTu_93cvsIoH8aAkB9EALw_wcB   

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
